directions: Prepare the soil by tilling it and removing any weeds or rocks.
Plant the corn seeds in rows, leaving enough space between each seed.
Water the seeds immediately after planting, making sure the soil is moist.
Place the corn stalks in an area that receives full sunlight for at least 8 hours a day.
Water the corn regularly, aiming for about an inch of water per week.
Apply fertilizer to the soil once the corn reaches a height of about 6 inches.
Continue to water and care for the corn until the ears are fully developed and the husks turn brown.
Harvest the corn by pulling back the husks and picking the ears when they are fully mature.
Remove the silks and cook the corn by boiling, grilling, or steaming.
